alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 23 at 1:32PM CDT until July 23 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a * Tornado Warning for... South central Livingston County in central Illinois... * Until 215 PM CDT. * At 132 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Chenoa, or 7 miles southwest of Pontiac, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Livingston County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
